body: I feel there is more to this story than what is presented... I feel like that murder scene was more of a cover up or something going on behind this.

Can anyone direct me to the one where a guy from a rich family likes a girl but she's already abused by her father and then the guy asks this old family youkai or something to kill the father with disease  in exchange for his seed? And in the end the girl doesn't like him and he decides to rage rape the youkai

Ayame looks a hell of a lot like the main fox from the Gedo series...She did disappear in the final chapter after turning white. I wonder if there's a connection or just similar art styles because same author?
Ah batta. One page sex scenes, kitsunes, and dark, depressing themes.
Wait. Batta? That same Batta who's drawing those cute and funny kemono friends 4komas!?
Oh come on. The story got me intrigued but it went nowhere.
the sex scenes are so short i read it for the story..

I feel like their is something going on behind the scenes for example look at how the black hair girl talks to the girl when they first meet "you are foolish" and also isn't it odd that when someone is killed they don't really care or is even a little worried about their own when there neck is sliced open? I mean normally when someone is killed they would increase security or put on a funeral but instead they just brush it off like it's a normal thing that happens once in awhile, i would like to see more what happens in the future and what is going on really
